bioghist.p: The Philadelphia Academy of Surgery was organized by Samuel D. Gross on 21 Apr. 1879; it was incorporated in Dec. 1879. The academy was established to promote surgical science through presentation of cases and specimens, discussions, and publications. Original officers included a president, two vice-presidents, recording and corresponding secretaries, a pathological histologist, and a librarian. There was also a five-member Council. The academy's membership is composed of resident, non-resident, corresponding, and honorary fellows. The Academy's meetings are held at the College of Physicians of Philadelphia.
